ref: 1390 *āluḍati ʻ moves to and fro ʼ. 2. ālōḍayati ʻ stirs up ʼ Suśr. [Cf. ālulita -- ʻ agitated ʼ Mālatīm., ālōlita -- ʻ shaken ʼ MW.: √luḍ].
Pa. āluḷati ʻ moves here and there ʼ, āluḷēti ʻ sets in motion ʼ;
S. āluṛaṇu ʻ to ebb (of the tide) ʼ; --
Si. älalīma ʻ unrest, confusion ʼ Geiger ES 19, but rather der. (h)alalanavā < saṁlālayati.
